# Draft:Discovery High School (Bronx)

Discovery High School is a public high school located on the second floor of the Walton Educational Campus at 2780 Reservoir Avenue, in the Kingsbridge Heights neighborhood of the Bronx, New York City. Established in 2003, the school serves students in grades 9 through 12 and operates under the New York City Department of Education, District 10. The school shares its building with five other high schools. Mission and Curriculum
Discovery High School is dedicated to high academic standards, social-emotional development, and a close-knit, family-like environment, supported by committed staff. Its mission emphasizes preparing students for college and life by teaching them to think critically and to develop deep comprehension and metacognitive skills.
Student Body and Performance
With approximately 400–425 students, Discovery maintains a favorable student‑teacher ratio of about 14–15:1 ￼. The student population is predominantly Hispanic (~80%) with a significant portion of Black students (~14–15%) ￼. Academic proficiency rates are strong: around 92% in reading and 77% in math, with a 92% graduation rate and average SAT scores near 1090 .
Support Services and Extracurriculars
Discovery is noted for catering to diverse learners, including newcomers, credit‑deficient older students, and students with special needs (over 25% of the population) . Collaborations with external organizations, such as the Institute for Career Development, support students with disabilities in transitioning to postsecondary life . A wellness initiative won the school an “Excellence in School Wellness” award in 2011, recognizing their on-site organic gardening and student-led farmers’ markets . Staff work collaboratively in planning, and the school employs team‑based instruction using both traditional and modern tools . Metal detectors at campus entrances ensure security, and staggered entry times help manage flow . Facilities
Discovery occupies shared spaces on Walton Campus’s second floor, including access to a gymnasium, auditorium, and lunchroom . A new campus library, opened April 2025, serves all five campus schools, offering books, computers, and collaborative spaces
Notable Alumni
Alumni testimonials highlight Discovery’s supportive culture and lasting impact. Many credit faculty, including Principal Rolando Rivera, with fostering confidence, academic success, and career preparation.
